Biang Kerok Harga Gas Industri RI Lebih Mahal dari Malaysia
05 Nov 2019, 01:37 by Trio Hamdani


Ilustrasi Foto: dok. Kemenperin

Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) turun tangan memerintahkan Menteri Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) mengecek harga gas industri yang menurutnya mahal hingga dikeluhkan dunia usaha.Jokowi pun memastikan tak ada kenaikan harga gas industri. Hal itu mengonfirmasi bahwa PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk atau PGN batal menaikkan harga gas per 1 November 2019 ini.Benarkah harga gas industri di Indonesia mahal? Apa biang keroknya? Pengamat energi dari Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM) Fahmi Radhi menjelaskan bahwa harga gas industri di Indonesia relatif di tengah-tengah dibandingkan negara lainnya di Asia. Bila dibandingkan Malaysia memang Indonesia lebih mahal.Harga gas industri Malaysia di hulu adalah US$ 4,5-6 sedangkan Indonesia US$ 6-8 per MMBTU. Lalu harga di pengguna, Malaysia US$ 7,5-8,21, Indonesia US$ 8-10 per MMBTU."Kalau dibandingkan negara-negara ASEAN, Malaysia memang lebih murah, di bawah sedikit," kata dia saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Namun harga gas industri di Indonesia relatif lebih murah dibandingkan Singapura US$ 12,5-14,5 dan China US$ 15 per MMBTU di tingkat pengguna."Di Singapura harganya (di pengguna) itu sekitar US$ 12,5 per MMBTU, nah di China itu sekitar US$ 15," sebutnya.Lanjut ke halaman berikutnya >>> (toy/ang)

The price of Indonesian Industrial Gas is more expensive than Malaysia
05 Nov 2019, 01:37 by Trio Hamdani


Photo Illustration: doc. Ministry of Industry

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) intervened to instruct the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) to check the price of industrial gas which he said was expensive to be complained by the business world. Jokowi also ensured that there was no increase in industrial gas prices. This confirms that PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk or PGN canceled raising the gas price as of November 1, 2019. Is it true that the price of industrial gas in Indonesia is expensive? What is the culprit? Energy observer from Gadjah Mada University (UGM) Fahmi Radhi explained that the price of industrial gas in Indonesia is relatively in the middle compared to other countries in Asia. When compared to Malaysia, Indonesia is indeed more expensive. The price of Malaysian industrial gas in the upstream is US $ 4.5-6 while Indonesia is US $ 6-8 per MMBTU. Then the price in users, Malaysia US $ 7.5-8.21, Indonesia US $ 8-10 per MMBTU. "When compared to ASEAN countries, Malaysia is indeed cheaper, below a little," he said when contacted by AFP, Jakarta , Monday (11/04/2019). But the price of industrial gas in Indonesia is relatively cheaper than Singapore at US $ 12.5-14.5 and China at US $ 15 per MMBTU at the user level. "In Singapore the price (at the user) is around US $ 12.5 per MMBTU, now in China it's around US $ 15, "he said. Continue to the next page >>> (toy / ang)
